security: Disclosing details about the establishment of official cover backstopping, including the use of the U.S. Army Staff Group and specific procedures for managing documentation and ID cards, could compromise covert operations. Quoting directly: "all information concerning this cover arrangement is available in the Official Cover and Liaison Section, CCD" and "Subject has been issued Unit ID Card No. 363 for domestic use only."
summary: A memo from Joseph M. Adams, Chief of Official Cover & Liaison, CCD Branch, CCG, to the Chief, NE, regarding the establishment of official cover backstopping for Calvin W. Hicks, utilizing the U.S. Army Staff Group.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated September 29, 1960, is from Joseph M. Adams, Chief of Official Cover & Liaison, CCD Branch, CCG, to the Chief, NE, Attention Mr. Gardner, concerning the establishment of official cover backstopping for Calvin W. Hicks. The memo indicates that official cover utilizing the U.S. Army Staff Group has been arranged and that all information is available in the Official Cover and Liaison Section, CCD. It requests notification when the cover arrangement is no longer required and specifies procedures for managing Hicks' Unit ID Card No. 363, including its retrieval during PCS moves, TDY trips, or resignation from the Agency.
title: Calvin W. HICKS: Establishment of Official Cover Backstop
